Mr. RASKIN. Madam Speaker, I yield 2 minutes to the gentlewoman from  California (Ms. Kamlager-Dove), a very distinguished member of the  Judiciary Committee.

Mr. RASKIN. Madam Speaker, I have no more speakers, and I reserve the  balance of my time.

Mr. Speaker, I really appreciate Ms. Kamlager-Dove's voice in  Congress, from…

Ms. KAMLAGER-DOVE. Mr. Speaker, I rise today in strong opposition to  H.R. 2189.

Let's get honest about what this bill does and doesn't do. It does  not require training. It does not…

Ms. KAMLAGER-DOVE. Mr. Speaker, I rise in fierce opposition to this  performative and misleading resolution that reads like a cheap script  treatment looking for a second-rate director.…

Ms. KAMLAGER-DOVE. Mr. Speaker, I rise in strong support of Chuy  Garcia and against this resolution. I am, in fact, appalled at the  hubris behind all of this.

Ms. KAMLAGER-DOVE. Mr. Speaker, on October 7, my constituent, Vicente  Ventura Aguilar, was snatched off the street by Federal immigration  agents.

Ms. KAMLAGER-DOVE. Mr. Speaker, I rise in opposition to the so-called  CLARITY Act.

Ms. KAMLAGER-DOVE.  3614, the Fairness, Inclusion, Rehabilitation, and  Expungement for Firefighters Act.
Ms. KAMLAGER-DOVE. Mr. Speaker, I rise in strong opposition to this  package. It is embarrassing. It is trifling. This is a funding package  that Republicans actually agreed to and voted…

Mr. MAST. Mr. Speaker, I don't quite reserve yet.

I would let the next speaker on the other side know that they lost  116--Ms. Kamlager-Dove had 116 overdoses in the last year. I can count  at least six individuals killed recently by MS-13. The President is  working to protect her district from MS-13.
